item.title: Kelly add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Let us read, and let us dance; these two amusements will never do any harm to the world." -- Voltaire

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I declare after all there is no enjoyment like reading! How much sooner one tires of any thing than of a book! -- When I have a house of my own, I shall be miserable if I have not an excellent library." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Kelly add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Marisa de los Santos
item.description: "It's a well-known fact. All women are clinically insane, but especially ballet dancers. Psycho. extremely psycho. Trust me." -- Marisa de los Santos

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Riding a horse is not a gentle hobby, to be picked up and laid down like a game of solitaire. It is a grand passion. It seizes a person whole and once it has done so, he/she will have to accept that his life will be radically changed." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Helen Thompson
item.description: "In riding a horse, we borrow freedom" -- Helen Thompson

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Perhaps all the dragons in our lives are princesses who are only waiting to see us act, just once, with beauty and courage. Perhaps everything that frightens us is, in its deepest essence, something helpless that wants our love." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Peggy Tabor Millin
item.description: "We never touch people so lightly that we do not leave a trace." -- Peggy Tabor Millin

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Tertullian
item.description: "Certum est, quia impossible est." -- Tertullian

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Christopher Marlowe
item.description: "Quod Me Nutrit Me Destruit." -- Christopher Marlowe

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "The best argument against democracy is a five-minute conversation with the average voter." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description:
"He has all the virtues I dislike and none of the vices I admire."
<a href="http://www.winston-churchill-leadership.com/churchill-quote-others.html">[On British Labour politician Stafford Cripps.]</a>" -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "If you are going through hell, keep going." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Men occasionally stumble over the truth, but most of them pick themselves up and hurry off as if nothing ever happened." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "If you cannot read all your books...fondle them---peer into them, let them fall open where they will, read from the first sentence that arrests the eye, set them back on the shelves with your own hands, arrange them on your own plan so that you at least know where they are. Let them be your friends; let them, at any rate, be your acquaintances." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "From now on, ending a sentence with a preposition is something up with which I will not put." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Kelly add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Justina Chen Headley
item.description: "Getting lost is just another way of saying 'going exploring." -- Justina Chen Headley

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Politics is the art of looking for trouble, finding it everywhere, diagnosing it incorrectly and applying the wrong remedies." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Jillian Michaels
item.description: "A bad day for your ego is a great day for your soul." -- Jillian Michaels

item.title: Kelly add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "Weeds are flowers, too, once you get to know them." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Kelly add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "Some people talk to animals. Not many listen though. That's the problem." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "I long to accomplish a great and noble task, but it is my chief duty to accomplish small tasks as if they were great and noble." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic." -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Roger Ebert
item.description: "Doing research on the Web is like using a library assembled piecemeal by pack rats and vandalized nightly. " -- Roger Ebert

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "There is no Frigate like a Book To take us Lands away, Nor any Coursers like a Page Of prancing Poetry – This Traverse may the poorest take Without oppress of Toll – How frugal is the Chariot That bears a Human soul." -- Emily Dickinson
